net.grinder.engine.process
Interface DispatchContext

interface DispatchContext

Access state related to a particular dispatch of a test by a worker thread.

Author:
Philip Aston

Nested Class Summary
static class DispatchContext.DispatchStateException
          Exception that indicates the dispatcher was in an invalid state for the called method .
 
Method Summary

Method Detail

getTest

Test getTest()
The test.

Returns:
The test that this dispatch is for.

getStatisticsForTest

Statistics.StatisticsForTest getStatisticsForTest()
Creates a Statistics.StatisticsForTest through which the script can query and update the statistics. The statistics are only mutable update until the next time report() is called; after that time the Statistics.StatisticsForTest is disassociated from this DispatchContext and the statistics are read-only.

Returns:
The handle the script uses to update the statistics, or null if there currently is no test in progress.

report

void report()
            throws DispatchContext.DispatchStateException
Report any pending statistics.

Throws:
DispatchContext.DispatchStateException - If there are no statistics to report.

getPauseTimer

StopWatch getPauseTimer()
Return a StopWatch which can be started and stopped around code that should not contribute to the elapsed time measurement.

Returns:
The stop watch.

getElapsedTime

long getElapsedTime()
If there is a test in progress, return the elapsed time since the start of the test. If a test has been completed, but not reported, return the test time. Otherwise return -1.

Returns:
The elapsed time for the test.

setHasNestedContexts

void setHasNestedContexts()
Set that this DispatchContext has nested contexts.
